info.title: TradeEventsAPI
info.description: The Trade Events API provides data on events for U.S. businesses interested in selling their products and services overseas. These events include industry conferences, webinars, lectures, and trade missions organized by ITA and other trade agencies.

get.description: The Trade Events API provides data on events for U.S. businesses interested in selling their products and services overseas. These events include industry conferences, webinars, lectures, and trade missions organized by ITA and other trade agencies.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the registration_title, description, event_name, industries, city, venues.city, venues.state, venues.country, contacts.first_name, contacts.last_name, and contacts.person_title fields.

parameters.name: industries
parameters.description: Returns trade events for specific controlled industry terms. This method allows you to search for multiple industries (plural) separated by commas.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns trade events for a specific country based on ISO alpha-2 country codes. This method allows you to search for multiple countries (plural) separated by commas but will only return one country (singular) per event.

parameters.name: trade_regions
parameters.description: Returns trade events for a specific Trade Region.  Enter multiple values by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: world_regions
parameters.description: Returns trade events for a specific World Region.  Enter multiple values by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Searches only the events specified by the Source Abbreviation.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Returns events based on their start date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Returns events based on their end date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

start_time.description: The start time of the event.

end_date.description: The date the event will end.

end_time.description: The end time of the event.

time_zone.description: The time zone of the eventâ€™s location.

registration_link.description: URL for the event's registration page.

source_industry.description: The industry category assigned to the event by the source.

industry.description: Industry categories assigned to the event.

url.description: Link to the event's web page.

click_url.description: Link to the event's web page.

venues.description: Array of hashes for information about each venue including country, city, country_name, location, and state.

contacts.description: Array of hashes of contact information including post, phone, last_name, person_title, first_name, and email.

country.description: The country associated with the event.
